title: The Discipline of Obedience
devotional:
Imagine a skilled craftsman meticulously shaping a piece of wood. He starts with a rough, unformed block, but with each precise cut and careful sanding, he transforms it into something beautiful and useful. Now, picture God as that craftsman, and you as the piece of wood. He sees the potential within you, the beauty waiting to be revealed. But to realize that potential, you must be willing to submit to His skilled hands, trusting His vision for your life, even when the process feels uncomfortable or unclear.

Obedience isn't about blind compliance; it's about recognizing God's wisdom and surrendering your own will to His perfect plan. It's about trusting that He knows what's best for you, even when you don't understand. Think of a young child learning to ride a bike. They may resist their parent's guidance at first, wanting to do it their own way. But eventually, they realize that by following their parent's instructions, they can achieve their goal of riding independently. Similarly, when we obey God, we may initially struggle or question His direction, but ultimately, we discover the freedom and fulfillment that comes from aligning our lives with His will.

Obedience is also a continuous journey, not a one-time event. It requires daily choices to prioritize God's commands, to seek His guidance in every decision, and to resist the temptation to follow our own desires. It's about cultivating a heart that is receptive to His promptings and a mind that is committed to His truth. It is especially crucial when we are prompted by God to do things that are uncomfortable, confusing, or potentially lead to difficult situations. Remember, God promised he will never lead you somewhere that he will not equip you to handle.

In this new year, let us embrace the discipline of obedience, allowing God to shape us into the people He created us to be. Let us trust His vision, surrender our own will, and experience the joy of living in alignment with His perfect plan. Let us strive to always choose to obey, whether that means offering a helping hand to someone in need, remaining silent when gossip tempts us, or sharing the good news with those around us. When we are obedient to God, we find that He reveals himself in our lives more than we could ever imagine.
image_description: Close-up of a craftsman's hands carefully shaping a piece of wood with various tools on a workbench.
insights: Jesus exemplified perfect obedience throughout His earthly life. Philippians 2:8 states that He 'humbled himself by becoming obedient to the point of death, even death on a cross.' This demonstrates the depth of His commitment to the Father's will and serves as a model for our own obedience. Similarly, in John 14:15, Jesus says, 'If you love me, you will keep my commandments,' highlighting the connection between love and obedience.
prayer: Heavenly Father, I confess that I often struggle with obedience. I allow my own desires and fears to cloud my judgment and lead me astray. Forgive me for the times I have resisted Your guidance and pursued my own will. Grant me the strength to surrender my life to Your perfect plan and the wisdom to discern Your voice in every decision. Help me to cultivate a heart that is receptive to Your promptings and a mind that is committed to Your truth. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: In what areas of your life do you find it most difficult to obey God? What steps can you take to cultivate a more obedient heart? How can you actively seek God's guidance in your daily decisions?
